word_mean: 服水土，水土适应，气候适应：同acclimation
又称“气候驯化”。在自然气候条件下，有机体在其一生中为了降低由于外界压力变化所导致的紧张状态而产生的生理或行为变化。
在人工选择条件下，生物体的性状向人类所要求的方向变化的过程。

sentence.Network_en: Acclimatization to higher altitudes may take several weeks.
sentence.Network_cn: 适应较高的海拔可能需要几周时间。

sentence.Network_en: It would have been better if her acclimatization had been more gradual -- less rigid.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果嘉莉不是那么急剧地改变生活方式, 而是 逐渐地适应新的水土,事情也许会好些.

sentence.Network_en: In fact, leaves may adapt to sun or shade as a result of acclimatization.
sentence.Network_cn: 由于适应性, 叶片能适应向阳或遮阴的条件.

entry.tran: （使）适应；（使）服水土；（使）习惯于（新情况、新地方或新气候）
entry.def: When you acclimatize or are acclimatized to a new situation, place, or climate, you become used to it.

example.ex: The athletes are acclimatising to the heat by staying in Monte Carlo...
example.tran: 运动员通过留驻蒙特卡洛来适应酷热。

example.ex: This year he has left for St Louis early to acclimatise himself...
example.tran: 今年他早早地前往圣路易斯以便适应新环境。

means.word_mean: 1. adaptation to a new climate (a new temperature or altitude or environment)

auth_sentence.content: At altitude, the human body adjusts to taking more frequent, deeper breaths in a process called ventilatory acclimatization.
auth_sentence.res_content: At altitude, the human body adjusts to taking more frequent, deeper breaths in a process called ventilatory acclimatization.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: At altitude, the human body adjusts to taking more frequent, deeper breaths in a process called ventilatory acclimatization.
